page.title: 17Children in Oakley 1
page.content: Many of the children living in Oakley follow a wide range of pursuits out of school time. Activities include {Brownies, Guides, Cubs and Scouts.} They attend classes for ballet, tap and acrobatic{dancing.}They learn to play brass, woodwind and stringed {instruments}as well as the piano. Popular{sporting activities}are: football organised by Oakley Boys Football Club, swimming at Westfield Lido, tennis at Andover Road tennis courts, cricket at the club between Oakley Park and the railway line, badminton at Andover Road Village Hall and Basingstoke and majorette groups in Basingstoke. Some children also enjoy horse riding, cycling and judo. Much of this is only possible because parents are willing to take their children by car to the venues and can afford pay for the activities.
